pages.text: Engines are machines that produce energy from various sources. They can be used to power other machines.$(br2)Engines can be controlled by Redstone signal and can be rotated with Wrench.

pages.title: Overheating
pages.text: Engines need some time to heat up and produce full amount of energy and they cooldown when not used. Engines have no failsafe and must be monitored to prevent overheating.$(br2)$(#f00)If machine overheats it can explode!$()$(br2)Pro tip: Read overheat conditions to prevent it.$(br2)

Redstone Engine produces 0.007⚡/tick or 1.1E/s.$(br)Requires only Redstone signal.$(br2)Used for machines that require tiny amounts of energy to start up. The biggest advantaged of this engine is resource cost.$(br2)Can't explode.
Stirling Engine produces -⚡/tick or -E/s.$(br)Uses solid fuel.$(br2)Overheats after if cannot withdraw energy from it.
Combustion Engine produces -⚡/tick or -E/s.$(br)Uses liquid fuel.$(br2)Overheats if lacks water supply. Outputs Redstone signal via comparator before it overheats. Cannot start if too hot.
